alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 16 at 7:17PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following county, Mohave. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 715 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in the upper Detrital Wash, southwest of Dolan Springs. The storms are training over the same area as they move east-southeast. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.50 inches of rain have fallen, locally up to 0.75 inches. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dolan Springs, Pierce Ferry Road and desert areas west of Highway 93. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
